channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX

Bottom of the box was wet, and there was nothing inside the box. Box was moved to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: Three of the four bottles had loose caps. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Moved to the hazmat cage the bay doors were open, and the fans were on.

item.title: Report X-2023101375
item.description:
Report X-2023101375

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-16
  • City: BEAUMONT
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: After the driver picked up the hazmat he placed it on the floor of his truck. The driver laid the package down instead of following the orientation arrows position. Once the truck arrived back to the station. The Admin that responsible for the HAP noticed a substance on the floor. The Admin then noticed it was coming from one of the hazmat packages. DescribePack: Leakage from the cap, because the package was laying on it's side instead of being set up according to the orientation arrows. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in the right orientation.

  • Description: DMP RESPONDER WAS SENT ON A CALL TO DOOR 254 AND FOUND A HAZMAT PACKAGE CONTAMINATED BY ANOTHER LEAKING PACKAGE. THE LEAKING PACKAGE WAS CLEANED UP FOLLOWING DMP PROCEDURES. THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT BACK TO DMP AND OPENED; IT WAS FOUND THAT ONE OF THE CONTAINERS WAS INFACT LEAKING. THE HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS PROCESS FOLLOWING ALL DMP PROCEDURES WITHOUT INCIDENT

item.title: Report X-2023101139
item.description:
Report X-2023101139

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-20
  • City: IRVING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/20/23 at aproximately 1230, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 563935 to the station location in Irving, reporting an undeclared hazardous substance shipment. The shipment consists for eight fiberboard boxes, each containing one plastic jerrican labeled "Champignon Liquid" from China. The shipment emitted an odor, warranting further investigation. An online sds of a similar product revealed that the commodity is classifed as UN 3082. The shipment was not prepared in accordanace with IATA Regulations, having shipped without the requires markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The complete shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: BOX LEFT OUTSIDE OF HWPA, BAGGED, IN A RED TOTE. DescribePack: BOX IS WET, RIPPED/TORN ON ONE SIDE AND TOP CORNER. BOX ABSORBED LIQUID. INSIDE, 1 OF 4 BOTTLES HAS A LOOSE CAP THAT ALLOWED FOR LEAKAGE. ORIENTATION ARROWS NOT FOLLOWED. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: CAP TIGHTENED. ALL CONTENTS, MATERIALS AND PACKAGING PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM AND SEALED.

item.title: Report I-2023110011
item.description:
Report I-2023110011

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-14
  • City: Dallas
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Aircraft was being boarded when passenger sitting in seat 16C noticed smoke coming from their fanny pack. They stood up but could not exit the aircraft because passengers were still boarding and isle way was congested. Passenger passed the fanny pack to other passengers until the fanny pack was thrown in the jetway and doused with water by a deadhead flight attendant. When smoking had ceased and device was cooled down, it was removed. Flight continued to board and departed. Photos upon request.

  • Description: While cargo agent was unloading from baggage cart at the cargo facility, the cargo agent felt the liquid on his hands when removing. Agent washed hands with warm soapy water. Package was bagged in a plastic bag to prevent further leakage on other materials. No leak was seen or noticed on aircraft.

item.title: Report X-2023100942
item.description:
Report X-2023100942

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: EDINBURG
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was inbound scanned at 0433. At approximately 0510 QA was called to unload managers desk by baydoor 12. QA was notified that HazMat package appeared to be leaking and that their was a strong smell emanating from package. Upon inspection it was found that one of the two items in the package had a loose top that allowed some of its inner contents to spill out. HazMat was placed in a salvage drum and moved to QA1 to process post sort. DescribePack: 2 items were found in the package. 1 was a gallon of paint and the other was a gallon of paint thinner. The lid on the can of paint thinner was loose and allowed some of its contents to spill out. Lower right corner of outer packaging appears to have a regangle shaped wet mark of about 3 x 5 inches. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as QA identified that the package was indeed a damaged HazMat the item was placed in a salvage drum, picked up from the unload and brought to QA1 to be processed post sort.

item.title: Report I-2023080050
item.description:
Report I-2023080050

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-22T00:34:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: CONVERSE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: US ECOLOGY TRANSPORTATION SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 21, 2023 at approximately 1030am a cargo tank trailer returning a rejected shipment of mixed acids from Gleco Plating started to leak on the shoulder of Loop 1604 in Converse Tx. Emergency responders were notified immediately, and US Ecology Emergency Response crews were dispatched from the US Ecology Cibolo Tx location less than 15 minutes away. The TCEQ and NRC were notified of the spill immediately after emergency response reaction. All lanes of Loop 1604 were closed between FM 78 and Lower Seguin Rd, they were re-opened around midnight once the highway was cleaned up. The Emergency Response crew unloaded waste from the tanker into totes until the tanker stopped leaking at which point it was transferred to the US Ecology Cibolo location to be stored within a bermed area for further unloading. All waste is being disposed of properly at an authorized facility and TX DOT has approved of the remediation at the spill site.
